data.title: develop - Improves iOS landscape support
data.body:
These changes are mainly to address issues #303 and #304, but they may also have an effect on #298.
### iOSGameView
- Replaces the dependency on MonoTouch's iPhoneOSGameView.  Changes
  needed to be made in that base class, and it seems unwise to be
  dependent on the MonoTouch release schedule for new features we may
  need.
- Correctly handles rotation (without destroying the GL context)
- Improves touch and gesture handling
### GameWindow
- Cleaned up and implemented as fully as an abstract base class can be
### GamerServicesComponent
- Removes a reference to the obsolete property 'Window' on
  GamerServices.Guide
### GraphicsDevice
- Marked some public static members as [Obsolete]
### SpriteBatch
- Corrected matrix recalculation when the Viewport changes
### GraphicsDeviceManager
- Now calls ApplyChanges in the constructor.
- ApplyChanges now does (a little) something:  calls
  GameWindow.SetSupportedOrientations
### TouchCollection
- Updated to provide (slightly) better behavior.  Previously touches
  would accumulate, despite having been processed by a call to
  TouchPanel.GetState.  This is a little better now.
### Guide
- Now discovers the UIWindow it needs via Game.Services.
### iOSGameWindow
- Rewritten as a fairly light implementation of GameWindow.
- This class now merely manages an iOSGameViewController (which manages
  the iOSGameView)
### GamePad
- Updated to use iOSGameView rather than GameWindow
### VideoPlayer
- Removed now-unnecessary Pause/Resume hack.
### iOSGamePlatform
- Now manages the run loop timer itself and calls Game.Tick to take
  advantage of the fixed-update-rate code path.
- Removed orientation handling.  iOSGameViewController now handles most
  of that.

RenderTarget - Only last call to spritebatch is drawn

data.title: Windows Fixes
data.body:
A bunch of fixes to both the core and Windows which got our game fully running on MonoGame.
- Rendering now obeys the fixed framerates.
- Fixed NormalizeShort2.
- Added NormalizeShort4.
- We now properly set the mip filters for DXT textures.
- Fixed BoundingFrustum.Contains(Plane).
- Optimized BoundingBox.Intersects(Plane).
- ReflectiveReader now properly loads value types.

data.body: All of the previous changes from the other pull request plus two changes to adapt my changes to android

data.title: CatapultWars does not render correctly under windows
data.body:
On Windows the GamePlay screen for this sample is all White.

Need to find out why this does not look right, the menu system is working fine.

data.title: Fixes SpriteBatch matrix compilation error on iOS
data.body: iOS had a compilation error left over from the merging of the GLES SpriteBatch classes.  Matrix4 => Matrix

data.body: A script to convert existing XNA projects to MonoGame projects would ease the transition for developers significantly.

Getting Started Guides
data.body: A pass through the current "Getting Started" materials is needed.  Make sure all the material that exists is correct and applicable.

data.title: Game.IsMouseVisible implementation for Windows
Fix resolution change to properly scale and preserve aspect ratio.
data.body:
Note:  I use SpriteBatch very little so this might break some things in SpriteBatch.

This prevents the screen from stretching.  So, if the resolution set is 4:3 resolution and you are using landscape, there will be 2 black bars on each side and the picture will be centered while preserving the aspect ratio.  This should also work in portrait mode but have not tested it.  This is how WP7 works.

data.title: Changed the Signin Delay for Android & SpriteBatch fix
data.body:
Changed the Signin Delay for Android
Added a fix for the SpriteBatch.cs (needs testing on other platforms)

data.title: Viewport Rendering Origin
data.body:
Creating a Viewport at {0, 0} (other coordinates too, of course) and rendering into it in XNA results in the texture being rendered starting at {0, 0} (top-left).  MonoGame currently renders to the lower-left (OpenGL's default origin?)
1. Create a visual test from the attached code sample
2. Make this test pass!

data.title: Windows Fixes
data.body:
A bunch of fixes for the windows codebase.
- Added stub for Texture2D.SaveAsJpeg()
- Fixed Allowing/Blocking of userResizing windows.
- Fixed setting and reading of window.Title.
- Added missing read of ReferenceAlpha in AlphaTextEffectReader.
- Rather than throwing an exception we now return a zero length sound for any ADPCM compressed sounds.

data.title: Small Fix
data.body:
Hi Kenneth and Dominique.

Hope things are going well with the project.

First a small fix from our new organization fork.

Me and my team (4 programmers total) will be jumping into MonoGame dev full time this week.  I figure it will take a week for them to get up to speed then we'll focus on Windows build for a bit then iOS and Win8.

data.title: Develop3d : mp3 files was missing a . in front when looking for supported sound file types
data.body: mp3 files was missing a . in front when looking for supported file types, in SoundEffectReader.cs, this was stoping mp3 files from loading correctly.

data.title: Updates ThirdParty/Libs submodule with from-source MonoMac.dll
data.body: Until the next official release of MonoMac, the develop3d branch must be compiled against MonoMac built from source.  So, for convenience until then (and so the build bot can build develop and develop3d), here is MonoMac.dll built from HEAD of the monomac master branch.
